No, cudnn can not be used for backward in evaluation mode, because math for backward in evaluation mode is different (because math for forward in evaluation mode is different), and cudnn does not support it.
Generally, no one should be ever running bn in evaluation mode (be it forward or backward), for eval mode it should be merged into previous convolution, there was an early pr to that effect that was abandoned #901

body:
No, cudnn can not be used for backward in evaluation mode, because math for backward in evaluation mode is different (because math for forward in evaluation mode is different), and cudnn does not support it. 
Generally, no one should be ever running bn in evaluation mode (be it forward or backward), for eval mode it should be merged into previous convolution, there was an early pr to that effect that was abandoned https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/901
